intro: Pleurostima brachycalyx, commonly known as the short-calyx pleurostis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, dry seeds. Pleurostima brachycalyx is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in arid environments.
